text:
You would use JavaScript on the front end to make your serverless call and then update the page. In fact the resources page we used for Developer Day does exactly this.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/developer-day-2021/resources>

It was built with vue.js, HS serverless, and HubDB.

For context - during the event the content of the page live updated during presentations to reveal the links related to the current presentation.
we have some other examples that are open source, I’ll see if I can find one quick

This event registration app uses reactjs, serverless functions and IIRC HubSpot Custom Objects to fully facilitate registration for an event, provide a “my events” view to the user, and a count of how many attendee slots to the event are left.

Because the objects are used the CRM record for the contacts then shows they registered for the event, and marketers can create workflows that automatically email the attendees etc.
